item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, May 18, 2025 at 8:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: I modeled the Voynich Manuscript with SBERT to test for structure (197 points | 48 comments)
2. Spaced repetition systems have gotten way better (523 points | 361 comments)
3. Ditching Obsidian and building my own (115 points | 147 comments)
4. $30 Homebrew Automated Blinds Opener (94 points | 31 comments)

6. The Fall of Roam (32 points | 4 comments)
7. Spaced Repetition Memory System (87 points | 8 comments)
8. Show HN: Buckaroo – Data table UI for Notebooks (48 points | 5 comments)
9. Emergent social conventions and collective bias in LLM populations (28 points | 5 comments)
10. Building my childhood dream PC (80 points | 37 comments)
11. Show HN: Hardtime.nvim – break bad habits and master Vim motions (127 points | 46 comments)
12. How the humble chestnut traced the rise and fall of the Roman Empire (23 points | 1 comment)
13. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (129 points | 10 comments)
14. An Uplifting Origin of 86 (2001) (22 points | 5 comments)

16. Magic Leap One Bootloader Exploit (50 points | 3 comments)

19. Mystical (338 points | 41 comments)
20. Show HN: A web browser agent in your Chrome side panel (108 points | 49 comments)

22. Comparing Parallel Functional Array Languages: Programming and Performance (4 points | discuss)
23. The RISC OS GUI (38 points | 7 comments)
24. Working with Git Patches in Apple Mail (2023) (34 points | 17 comments)
25. Show HN: Chat with 19 years of HN (96 points | 62 comments)
26. Paper Mechanisms (55 points | 2 comments)
27. Project Verona: Fearless Concurrency for Python (143 points | 111 comments)
28. O(n) vs. O(n^2) Startups (56 points | 53 comments)
29. The Conquest of Hell Gate [pdf] (46 points | 12 comments)
30. What Every Programmer Should Know About Enumerative Combinatorics (73 points | 38 comments)
